messages.message: In Search, the model tooltips don’t match our normal user-facing terminology. This is potentially confusing and is, at best, unhelpful. Tooltips should be using the terms already standard in the product. The “multistep lite model” tooltip should read _multistep model_ and “multistep model” tooltip should read _research model_.

Also, when I asked a question about our travel policy, I got a weird answer from a license document maybe? I don’t know because I did not have permissions to open the document.

Probably product has probably already considered this, but should Search be returning information from documents I don’t have permission to see? :philosoraptor:

I recast the question to ask about “Instabase’s travel policy,” and Search returned results from an outdated document. But I think the documents in the connected Human Resources drive might be old ones, so that was not Search’s vault.

Seems like another retrieval issues. We also need to look into why we show a doc in the source that’s the user don’t have permission! 

cc: @jayasooryan @Balaram
